½ cup pomegranate juice or a combo of juice and milk
⅓ cup (give or take) frozen assorted berries
directions_list: Place all ingredients in a food processor or blender and mix until smooth.
If you use your food processor, make sure to cover the top with a towel to catch any leaks.
If your smoothie is too thick, add a little more milk or juice and give it another quick whiz.
Enjoy!
Place ingredients as listed into your blending device
Blend until smooth
Garnish with cinnamon if desired
Enjoy!
name: Avocado Beet Smoothie
ingredient_lines: 1 small beet for ½ of a large beet cut into pieces/slices

name: Avocado Lemon Smoothie
directions_list: Scoop the flesh from the avocado.
Add the avocado flesh, lemon juice, lemon zest and sugar into a blender.
Add ice cubes for a cold smoothie (optional)
Blend well until smooth.
Then add the milk and blend again to mix.
Transfer to a serving glass.
Garnish with lemon zest.
Puree all ingredients in a high-speed blender until smooth. Serve immediately or refridgerate for up to 48 hours.
name: Avocado Blueberry Baby Smoothie
Banana & Avocado Smoothie
directions_list: Combine all ingredients in a blender. Blend until smooth. Add mixture to cup and enjoy!
Combine avocado, yogurt, milk, cream of coconut, and ice cubes in a blender; blend until smooth.
name: Coconut Avocado Smoothie
Spinach and Avocado Smoothie
ingredient_lines: 1 cup milk of your choice (I use an unsweetened almond & coconut blend)
1 serving vanilla protein powder (adjust to the amount of protein you want to add)
sweetener of your choice (Stevia, coconut sugar, honey, xylitol) optional
directions_list: Add all ingredients into a blender and pulse until there are no chunks of ice. Enjoy!
Peel and pit the avocado and roughly chop the flesh.
Transfer to a blender and add all the remaining ingredients.

Blend on high until silky smooth. If you're making a very thick version, a [url href="https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00LBFUKIA/ref=as_li_qf_sp_asin_il_tl?ie=UTF8&tag;=wwf05-20&camp;=1789&creative;=9325&linkCode;=as2&creativeASIN;=B00LBFUKIA&linkId;=83cabae2d851ac1bc8ffaf65634e0395" target="_blank"]Vitamix[/url] or a similar high-powered blender works best. You can also trying to make it in a food processor if your blender is having trouble dealing with the pudding-like consistency.
Taste test and add more milk if too thick or put in some extra sweetener (or more dates) if you like.
Pour into glasses and enjoy.
And don't forget those chocolate chips on top ;)
name: Chocolate Avocado Smoothie (Only 4 Ingredients!)
ingredient_lines: 1 tablespoon (5g) cocoa or cacao powder** for a raw version
1½ - 2 cups (360 - 480 ml) non-dairy milk (I used 1½ cup oat milk, use raw alternative for a fully raw version)***

name: 4 Ingredients Spinach Avocado Green Smoothie
ingredient_lines: 1 cup pineapple pieces fresh or frozen (1/2" to 1" size)
agave or honey (optional to adjust sweetness)
directions_list: Combine all ingredients in a blender and blend until get smooth consistency.
For more dark green color add more spinach. Also, add more or less water to get desired consistency.
We prefer not adding any sweetener. However, you can add the sweetener as per your preference.
In a blender, add almond milk, avocado, banana, cocoa, honey, and 1 cup of ice cubes.
Blend on high until smooth.
Serve immediately.
name: Avocado and Chocolate Smoothie
ingredient_lines: 1 cup vanilla flavoured almond milk (or your favourite milk)

name: Creamy Avocado Kale Smoothie
directions_list: Combine avocado, kale, cacao nibs, greek yogurt
almond milk, mango and honey in your blender and blend on high until all ingredients are mixed very well. Top with a tiny sprinkle of more cacao nibs to finish and enjoy!
Place all ingredients into your blending device as listed above
Blend until smooth
Enjoy!
name: Avocado Banana Power Smoothie
Avocado + Green Apple Smoothie
ingredient_lines: ½ cup sweetened almond or coconut milk
directions_list: Add all ingredients to a blender and blend on high for 1-2 minutes or until smooth.
Blend banana, avocado, coconut milk and honey in blender until smooth
Add ice cubes and blend until your desired thickness
ENJOY!
name: Paleo Avocado Banana Smoothie
ingredient_lines: ¼ Cup Coconut Milk - I use full fat

name: Citrus Mint Avocado - Summer Smoothie
directions_list: Wash and zest the oranges.
Then peel off the skin. Remove the white rind and segment the oranges.
Remove the white skin covering the pulp, as possible as you can.
Then place the orange pulp, avocado meat, mint leaves, orange zest and maple syrup in a blender.
Blend well to make a smooth and thick smoothie.
Serve immediately.
Place ingredients as listed above into your blending device
Blend until smooth
Enjoy!
name: Avocado Mango Smoothie
ingredient_lines: 4 oz coconut water - you can use regular water if you prefer

name: Blueberry, Banana and Avocado Smoothies
directions_list: Add all ingredients to blender, blend until smooth. Top with additional blueberries if desired.
Place all ingredients in a blender and process until perfectly smooth.
name: Green Avocado Smoothie with Chia Seeds
ingredient_lines: 1 tbsp agave syrup or sweeter of your preference

name: Avocado Banana Carrot Smoothie
ingredient_lines: 6 oz coconut water - you can use regular water if you prefer
directions_list: Place ingredients as listed into blending device
Blend until smooth
Enjoy!
Peel and dice the mango
Slice the avocado flesh from the skin.
Add the diced mango, avocado, lemon juice and sugar in a blender.
Blend until smooth, creamy and without any chunks.
Serve chilled.
name: Refreshing Mango Avocado Smoothie
Avocado Chocolate Peanut Butter Smoothie
ingredient_lines: 2 tablespoons cocoa powder (I used Dutch processed)
1½ cups unsweetened vanilla almond milk (more or less to desired consistency)
2 teaspoons zero-calorie sweetener, agave nectar, or honey (more or less to taste)
½ teaspoon vanilla extract (optional, but recommended)
directions_list: Add everything into a blender and blend on high for about 2 - 4 minutes, or until smooth and creamy. Add more milk as necessary to reach your desired thickness.
In a large bowl, combine the tomatoes, avocados, red onions and cilantro. Squeeze the lime juice over the top and drizzle with extra virgin olive oil. Gently stir. Taste and add salt as needed.
name: Avocado and Tomato Salad
ingredient_lines: 2 large tomatoes, cut into a large dice
2 avocados, cut into a large dice

name: Avocado Chicken Salad
directions_list: Cut cooked and cooled chicken breasts into ½ inch cubes.
Mash avocado until almost smooth. Add lime juice and stir until well blended. Add avocado mixture, chopped onion,and tomato slices to chicken. Toss lightly until well coated.
Salt to taste and serve.
In a medium bowl, combine avocados, onion, bell pepper, tomato, cilantro and lime juice. Gently toss until evenly coated. Season with salt and pepper.
name: Avocado Salad
Bacon, Corn and Avocado Salad
ingredient_lines: 4 ears corn, husks and silks removed
directions_list: Cut the kernels off the ears of corn and set aside.

Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the strips of bacon to the skillet and cook on both sides until the bacon is crisp, 6-8 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel-topped plate to cool. Drain off all but about 1 Tablespoon of bacon fat from the skillet and put it back on the stove over medium heat.

To the hot skillet, add the corn kernels, and leave them without stirring until they start to sizzle, 1-2 minutes. Continue cooking the corn, stirring occasionally, until it is cooked through and most kernels have started to brown in spots. Transfer to a large bowl. Refrigerate the corn until cool, at least 30 minutes.
Just before serving, combine the corn, red pepper, avocado, cilantro, and lime juice. Crumble the cooked bacon over the top and toss gently. Season with salt and pepper, to taste.
Add the eggs to a medium-sized pot and cover with a few inches of water. Cover and place on high heat. Bring water to a full (but gentle) boil and cook for 10 to 12 minutes.
Drain the water and immediately run cold water over the eggs. Transfer eggs to an ice bath and allow eggs to chill for 10 minutes. Refrigerate eggs until ready to use.
Peel and roughly chop the hard boiled eggs.

Add the avocado to a mixing bowl with the lemon juice and sea salt. Mash the avocado, leaving it slightly chunky if desired. Add the chopped hard boiled eggs and stir well to combine. Eat on toasted bread with watercress or greens of choice.
name: Avocado Egg Salad (mayo-free!)
ingredient_lines: 1-1/2 tablespoon fresh lemon juice (or lime juice)
½ teaspoon fine sea salt, or to taste

name: Grapefruit, Avocado, and Farro Arugula Salad
directions_list: Boil 1 cup of water and add in dry farro. Turn down to medium low heat and cover. Cook for 30-40 minutes, or until water is absorbed and farro is fluffy. Set aside.
Place arugula in a large bowl. Top with cooked farro, sliced, avocado, and grapefruit slices.

Whisk together the vinaigrette ingredients: olive oil, red wine vinegar, lime juice, honey, shallot, and salt and pepper. Pour a desired amount over the salads and toss (you will probably have leftover dressing). Dig in!
Stir together avocadoes, tomatoes, onion, and shrimp in a large bowl. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Stir in lime juice. Serve cold.
name: Avocado-Shrimp Salad
ingredient_lines: 1 pinch salt and pepper to taste

name: Cucumber Tomato Avocado Salad
ingredient_lines: 2 Tbsp extra virgin olive oil or sunflower oil
1 tsp sea salt or ¾ tsp table salt
directions_list: Place chopped tomatoes, sliced cucumber, sliced red onion, diced avocado, and chopped cilantro into a large salad bowl.
Drizzle with 2 Tbsp olive oil and 2 Tbsp lemon juice. Toss gently to combine. Just before serving, toss with 1 tsp sea salt and ⅛ tsp black pepper.

Add greens to a large mixing or serving bowl. Top with chunks of avocado and strawberry, toasted almonds, bacon crumbles and shredded mozzarella cheese. Drizzle the salad with the dressing and serve immediately.
name: Strawberry Avocado & Spinach Salad
ingredient_lines: 3 c. lightly packed spring mix greens
5-6 medium size strawberries, sliced into chunks
Dressing of your choice (I used Brianna's Rich Poppy Seed Dressing) but a vinaigrette would work too

name: Creamy Avocado Salad Dressing
ingredient_lines: 1/2 tablespoon fresh lime or lemon juice
directions_list: In a mini food processor add the peeled clove of garlic, avocado, lime or lemon juice, olive oil, salt and pepper.
Process until smooth, stopping to scrape down the sides a few times. Thin the salad dressing out with a little bit of water (1/4 cup to 1/2 cup) until it reaches a desired consistency.
Keep in an airtight container for at least a week, but 3 to 4 days is best.
Place avocado halves on a plate or serving platter. Drizzle warm bacon vinaigrette on top of the avocado. Spoon egg salad on top of avocado, salt and pepper to taste, and serve immediately.
name: Avocado Egg Salad
Avocado Pasta Salad
ingredient_lines: 2 cups uncooked bow tie pasta salad {whole grain}
directions_list: Begin by cooking the bow tie pasta as per the instructions.
Once pasta is finished cooking, rinse pasta under cold water.
In a small bowl, mash 1 avocado and mix in salt and pepper
In a large bowl. combine pasta, vegetables and avocado mix and gently mix.
Enjoy!
Add shrimp, avocado, and onion to a large bowl.
In a 2-cup measuring cup, mix together ingredients for the dressing. Whisk until well-combined.
Add dressing to shrimp avocado salad until it has the amount you desire. Serve additional dressing on the side.
name: Shrimp Avocado Salad
ingredient_lines: 2 pounds boiled or steamed shrimp, peeled and deveined
¼ cup extra virgin olive oil

name: Avocado Chicken Salad
ingredient_lines: ¼ cup finely chopped onion (can do red or yellow)
directions_list: Place chicken, mashed garlic and 1 tsp salt in a large pot with 2 quarts of water
Bring to a full boil, cover and turn off heat
Allow to sit for 10-15 minutes until the center of the breast reaches 165 degrees F
Drain chicken and set aside to cool
Shred chicken into a large bowl and add all other ingredients, except onions and cilantro.
When mixture is blended, stir in onions and cilantro.
Serve over a bed of greens or in your favorite wrap.
Cut the avocados in quarters lengthwise. Pit should fall out or easily twist out. Score it in a dice and scoop out with spoon into a medium bowl.
Peel cucumbers and dice. Add to bowl.
Toss salad with apple cider vinegar and salt and pepper to taste.
name: Cucumber Avocado Salad
ingredient_lines: 3 large avocados (we recommend California Hass Avocados because they are the bomb)
2 large cucumbers (we like english cucumbers but regular works too)
¼ cup apple cider vinegar (Bragg's is our go to ACV for everything)

name: Avocado Tuna Salad
ingredient_lines: 1/2 a very small red onion, diced
directions_list: Add Tuna, onion, 1/2 the avocado, celery, mustard powder, garlic powder, salt, pepper, cilantro, and mayo to one medium sized bowl.
With a fork, mash the avocado and tuna while mixing all ingredients together.
Add the other half of avocado and mix, but don't mash so that pieces of avocado remain intact.
Add Tuna Salad to your favorite bread and enjoy!
Mix all ingredients together in a medium size bowl gently. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.
name: Chickpea Avocado Salad
Avocado Chicken Salad
directions_list: In a large bowl, add the chicken, mayo, lime juice, garlic powder, salt and pepper.
Cut the avocado in half and dice into small pieces. Scoop the avocado out into the bowl and stir all of the ingredients together until it has reached your desired consistency.
Taste and adjust seasonings to your preference.
Serve and enjoy!
In a medium bowl, combine the chicken, red bell pepper, cherry tomatoes, corn and black beans.
In a food processor, combine the poblano pepper, cilantro, greek yogurt, lime juice, olive oil and salt and pepper. Pulse until well combined, then add to bowl with chicken. Mix well.
Cut your avocados in half and remove the pit. Spoon the chicken salad on top of the avocados and serve. Refrigerate any leftovers.
name: Southwest Chicken Salad Stuffed Avocado
ingredient_lines: 2 cups of cooked chicken (shredded or diced)
1 (15.5 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained

name: Grapefruit Arugula Salad With Avocado And Shrimp
ingredient_lines: 10 jumbo pre-cooked shrimp, peeled, deveined, and tails removed (see note)
directions_list: Segment the grapefruits, reserving 2 Tbsp of the grapefruit juice. Drink, or save remaining juice. Place segments in a large salad bowl. Pit, and slice the avocado. Remove slices from avocado skin and place in the same bowl. Add the arugula, shrimp, and cheese to the bowl.

Combine the grapefruit juice, vinegar, and olive oil in a small bowl or jar with tight fitting lid. Whisk or shake to emulsify. Drizzle about half the dressing onto the salad and toss to combine. Taste, and add more dressing if necessary. Season with salt and pepper. Toss to combine again.Serve and enjoy!

Make the sauce. In a medium bowl, whisk together the peanut butter, rice wine vinegar, lime juice, ginger, garlic, sesame oil, honey, and coconut aminos until creamy. Add the water, starting with a ¼ cup, whisking until smooth. If it still seems too thick, add the remaining ¼ cup.
Add sauce to chicken and stir to coat. Add the peppers, cabbage, scallions, cilantro, and cashews or peanuts and stir to combine.
Stuff chicken salad mixture into avocados and garnish with extra scallions, cilantro, chopped cashews, and a squeeze of lime!
name: Thai Chicken Salad Stuffed Avocados
ingredient_lines: 1 tablespoon soy sauce or coconut aminos
½ of a red bell pepper, diced
½ of a yellow bell pepper, diced
2 scallions, thinly sliced + extra for garnish
¼ cup chopped cilantro + extra for garnish
¼ cup chopped cashews or peanuts + extra for garnish
yield_amount: 3-4 as a meal, 6 as an appetizer

name: Avocado Chicken Salad
yield_amount: Enough filling for two sandwiches or salads
ingredient_lines: 1 ripe avocado, seeded and peeled (see How to Cut and Peel an Avocado)
1 apple, peeled, cored, and finely chopped
2 Tbsp finely chopped cilantro or parsley
2 teaspoons lime juice or a tablespoon of lemon juice
2 teaspoons lime juice or a tablespoon of lemon juice
Pinch of freshly ground black pepper
directions_list: Place the chicken, avocado, apple, celery, and red onion in a medium bowl. Gently mash the avocado with a fork and stir it around so that everything gets well mixed.
Add the cilantro or parsley, lime juice or lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Add more lime juice or salt to taste. If the mixture seems a little dry, you can stir in a teaspoon or two of olive oil.
To store, place in a bowl and cover completely with plastic wrap so that no part of the chicken salad is exposed to air. Will keep a couple of days in the fridge.
Serve on sandwich bread, toasted bread, or salad greens (I recommend arugula or watercress for extra zing).
Arrange avocado slices on a platter and top with the onion. Drizzle with olive oil and vinegar and season with salt and pepper, as desired. Serve immediately.
name: Avocado and Onion Salad
ingredient_lines: 3 large avocados, thinly sliced 1/4 small red onion, very thinly sliced 1 Tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil 1 Tablespoon red wine vinegar salt and freshly ground pepper, to taste
3 large avocados, thinly sliced 1/4 small red onion, very thinly sliced 1 Tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil 1 Tablespoon red wine vinegar salt and freshly ground pepper, to taste
3 large avocados, thinly sliced 1/4 small red onion, very thinly sliced 1 Tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil 1 Tablespoon red wine vinegar salt and freshly ground pepper, to taste
1/4 small red onion, very thinly sliced

name: Corn Black Bean and Avocado Salad
ingredient_lines: 1 cup fresh corn cooked (or canned corn)
salt and black pepper to taste
salt and black pepper to taste
directions_list: Combine all vegetables and black beans in a large bowl.
Combine lime juice, olive oil, garlic, salt and pepper in a small bowl and stir to combine.
Drizzle dressing over salad.
Refrigerate at least 30 minutes before serving.
Add all ingredients to a bowl and mash and stir to combine.
Serve on bread or open faced-on toast.
name: Healthy Avocado Egg Salad
Avocado Egg Salad
ingredient_lines: 2 slices of any kind of toasted bread
directions_list: Mix avocado, eggs, yogurt, lemon juice, salt and pepper in a bowl.
Put some arugula on toasted bread slices
Spoon the salad on the toast and enjoy!

Husk the corn and cut the kernels from the cob. (See our How-To’s here.) Heat the tablespoon of olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat and sauté the corn for 3 minutes, stirring constantly, until slightly tender. Remove from the heat and transfer to a large bowl. Cool completely to room temperature.
While the corn is cooling, cut the grape tomatoes in half and cut the avocado into ½ inch pieces. (You can also slice the onions and drain the black beans at this point.)
To make the dressing, in a small bowl, whisk together the ½ cup olive oil, chopped fresh cilantro, lime zest and lime juice. Add a pinch of salt and a few grinds of black pepper.
To the large bowl with the corn, add the halved tomatoes, diced avocado, red onion, and beans. Pour in the dressing and toss gently. Add additional salt and pepper to taste as desired.
name: Avocado, Corn and Tomato Salad
ingredient_lines: ½ cup very thinly sliced red onion
½ cup canned black beans, drained and rinsed
½ cup extra virgin olive oil
½ cup packed chopped fresh cilantro
Two tablespoons freshly squeezed lime juice
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste

name: Kale Avocado Salad
ingredient_lines: ¼ tsp cayenne pepper (we leave this out for kid's snacks)
directions_list: Add all ingredients except tomatoes into a mixing bowl.
Using your hands, squeeze the kale and avocado until the kale wilts and the avocado is evenly blended (3-4 minutes).
Sprinkle tomatoes over the top and serve.
To make the balsamic reduction, add balsamic vinegar and brown sugar to a small saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a slight boil and reduce by half, about 6-8 minutes; set aside and let cool.
Heat olive oil in a medium skillet over medium high heat.
Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper, to taste. Add to skillet and cook, flipping once, until cooked through, about 3-4 minutes per side. Let cool before dicing into bite-size pieces.
To assemble the salad, place romaine lettuce in a large bowl; top with chicken, mozzarella, tomatoes, avocado and basil. Pour balsamic reduction on top of the salad and gently toss to combine.
Serve immediately.
name: Caprese Avocado Salad
ingredient_lines: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste
1 avocado, halved, seeded, peeled and diced

name: Tangy Cucumber and Avocado Salad
directions_list: In a large bowl, combine cucumbers, avocados, and cilantro. Stir in garlic, onions, salt, and pepper. Squeeze lemon and lime over the top, and toss. Cover, and refrigerate at least 30 minutes.

In a large serving bowl, toss together the tomatoes, avocados and red onion. Dust lightly with black pepper, and pour salad dressing over. Cover and chill for at least one hour before serving to blend flavors.
name: Avocado and Tomato Salad
ingredient_lines: 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper, or to taste
1 (8 ounce) bottle balsamic vinaigrette salad dressing

name: Avocado, Tomato & Corn Salad
ingredient_lines: 1 1/2 cups corn (cut from 2-3 ears or frozen/thawed)
directions_list: Heat a grill pan over medium-high heat and brush a light layer of oil on the pan. Add the corn to the grill pan and cook for about 10 minutes, until the corn is lightly browned, stirring occasionally.

Combine the avocados, tomatoes, toasted corn, and red onion in a large bowl. In a small bowl, mix the lime juice, salt and pepper. Pour over the veggies and stir until combined. Refrigerate the salad for at least 45 minutes, up to 4 hours. Serve cold.
Cassie's notes:

To prepare the day or night before: prepare as instructed above, except do not add the avocados. When ready to serve, add the peeled & diced avocados and stir to combine with the other ingredients. The avocados can be added in advance, but will start to brown if the salad is left to chill overnight.

Put the tomatoes, tomatillos, avocado, and cilantro in a bowl. Drizzle the lime juice and olive oil and toss to combine. Season with salt and garnish with additional chopped cilantro if you like. Serve immediately, or refrigerate overnight (the avocado will become slightly discolored but the taste will still be fantastic).
name: Heirloom Tomato, Tomatillo, and Avocado Salad
ingredient_lines: 1 pound (about ½ kilo) various heirloom tomatoes, chopped

name: Southwestern Avocado Salad Dressing
ingredient_lines: 1 teaspoon ranch seasoning powder (homemade or storebought)
directions_list: Slice the avocado in half, remove the pit, and scoop the flesh from the skin. Add to a blender along with all of the other ingredients. Blend together until smooth and creamy. Refrigerate for one hour before serving.
Keeps in the fridge for 3 days.
Whisk the mayonnaise, lime juice, onions, salt and pepper together in a mixing bowl. Gently fold in the avocado and chicken until all the pieces are coated.
name: Avocado Chicken Salad
Sriracha Avocado Chicken Salad
ingredient_lines: 2 cups cooked boneless skinless chicken breast (I use leftover roasted chicken if I have it)
Sriracha sauce for drizzling (The hotter you like it the more you use!)
directions_list: In a medium bowl mash avocados, mix in lime, honey and garlic.
Toss chicken in your avocado mixture and coat. Salt to taste.
Serve with pita bread or eat it as is! Enjoy 🙂
Squeeze lemon juice over cubed avocado. Combine ingredients in a large bowl and enjoy (mash chickpeas beforehand if using this as sandwich filling).
name: Avocado Chickpea Salad with Vegan Pesto
ingredient_lines: 2 handfuls spring mix or arugula, sliced

name: Avocado Chicken Salad
directions_list: Mix all ingredients in a large bowl.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 20-30 minutes to let all the flavors blend together.
Serve on your favorite bread, crackers, pita pocket or on a bed of lettuce.
Arrange the lettuce, strawberries, kiwi, avocado and almonds in a salad bowl.
Whisk together the remaining ingredients to form the dressing and drizzle over salad.
name: Strawberry Avocado Honey Lime Salad
Avocado Egg Salad
directions_list: Mash the eggs with a fork in a mixing bowl to break up. Add the avocado, onion, pickle, mustard, and mayonnaise. Gently smash the ingredients together until blended. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
In a large bowl, toss together shredded lettuce, avocado, chickpeas, scallions, cooked rice, and cojita cheese.
In a separate bowl, whisk together ingredients for the dressing, Pour over the salad and toss until salad is coated.
name: Avocado Salad with Chickpeas
ingredient_lines: 4 scallions, diced through part of the greens

name: Avocado BLT Pasta Salad
directions_list: Cook the pasta as directed on the package before draining and running cold water over it to cool it.
Meanwhile cook the bacon and set aside on paper towels to drain and cool before crumbling.
Mix everything, toss in the dressing and enjoy!
Preheat oven to 350˚ F.
Cover Kamut with water and bring to a boil. Let cook until Kamut is tender, roughly an hour. Drain and set aside.
Cut carrots into 1/2" slices. Toss with olive oil and 1/2 teaspoon chipotle powder (add more for a hotter dish). Roast for 20-25 minutes or until carrots are tender.
While carrots roast, remove avocado from skin and dice into large pieces.
Toss together kamut, roasted carrots, avocado, and sunflower seeds. Whisk together olive oil, honey, and lime juice. Drizzle over kamut and lightly toss. Serve with a sprinkle of cilantro.
name: Chipotle Carrot, Avocado, and Kamut Salad
Bacon Avocado Salad
ingredient_lines: 2 cups spinach or your favorite salad greens, chopped
1-2 pieces bacon, cooked and crumbled (reserve the warm bacon fat)
directions_list: Add the greens, avocado, bacon, and goat cheese to a bowl or layer onto a plate. Drizzle with warm bacon fat (this is the dressing!). Add salt and pepper to taste.
In a medium bowl, combine chickpeas, avocado, cilantro, green onion, feta cheese, and lime juice. Stir until mixed well. Season with salt and pepper. Serve.
name: Chickpea, Avocado, & Feta Salad
ingredient_lines: Salt and black pepper, to taste
Salt and black pepper, to taste
